section.title: Use the Content-Disposition metadata
section.para: To override the default behavior for a browser, use the Content-Disposition header to specify the override behavior and assign this header to an object. For example, this header might specify that the browser use a download program to save this file rather than show the file, which is the default.

para.emphasis: Example Override browser default behavior request: HTTP

section.para: This example assigns an attachment type to the Content-Disposition header. This attachment type indicates that the file is to be downloaded as goodbye.txt:
section.screen:
